text: CEO Ben van Beurden at @oilandmoney conference “The 4 signposts for short term oil prices: the economy, OPEC, US shale & capital cost.”
"Shell is planning for a longer period of low prices. But for the longer term I see no change to fundamental drivers of oil markets."

Shell just released its 3rd quarter 2015 financial results #ShellResults
Shell’s Q3 2015 CCS earnings, including identified items, were $-6.1bn, down from $5.3bn in Q3 2014 #ShellResults
Shell’s Q3 2015 CCS earnings, excluding identified items, were $1.8bn, down from $5.8bn in Q3 2014 #ShellResults
Watch CFO Simon Henry comment on Shell’s Q3 2015 results: https://t.co/9dmk0iCMWt #ShellResults
Shell CEO Ben van Beurden: “Shell’s integrated business and our performance drive are helping to mitigate the impact of low oil prices.
“We continue to improve the operational performance of our assets, and production volumes are up.
“Costs are falling across the company and Shell’s performance drive is delivering at the bottom line.
“The BG deal, which remains on track…is a springboard to focus Shell into fewer and more profitable themes, deep water and integrated gas.”
Download Shell’s full 3rd quarter 2015 results announcement here: https://t.co/2LYSgdn7BV #ShellResults
